decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings / document title number(s): SKA GF 08 00 01 (Site Location Plan); SKA GF 05 90 01 (Plans and Elevations as Existing); SKA GF 08 00 02 (Site Plan as Proposed); SKA GF 08 00 03 (Ground Floor Plan as Proposed); SKA GF 08 10 01 (First Floor Plan as Proposed); SKA GF 08 20 01 (Second Floor Plan as Proposed); SKA GF 08 30 01 (Roof Plan as Proposed); SKA GF 05 90 02 (Acosutic Build-ups); SKA GF 08 70 01 (Elevations as Proposed); Design and Access Statement (SK Architecture); Demolition Method Statement (SK Architecture); Ventilation System Statement; Drimaster Eco Nox Brochure (Nuaire); Dri-Eco-Nox User Guide (Nuaire); Acoustic Report Version 2.0 R/PC7/1/240517 (Auricl Acoustic Consulting); Lignacite Brochure (Lignacite); Preliminary Ecological Appraisal R2693_PEA_a (John Wenman Ecological Consultancy); Biodiversity Net Gain Assessment Report R2693_BNG_a (John Wenman Ecological Consultancy)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any subsequent amendment, revision or new Order), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.

Reason: To protect residential amenities, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D6 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 or any Order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification, no extension, enlargement, or other alteration of the new flats other than that expressly authorised by this permission shall be carried out without planning permission first obtained from the local planning authority.

Reason: The local planning authority considers that further development could cause detriment to the amenities of the occupiers of nearby properties or the character of the area and, for this reason, would wish to control any future development with regard to policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policy 1.1 (g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policy D6 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| Notwithstanding the approved plans, refuse/recycling storage shall be provided in accordance with Council policies and brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with Policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) Policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policies D3 and SI8 of the London Plan (2021). | Notwithstanding the submitted plans, 12 secure and covered cycling spaces for the new flats shall be provided prior to the first occupation and retained thereafter.

Reason: To encourage the use of sustainable transport, provide for adequate cycle parking facilities and to safeguard the appearance of the property and the amenities of the area, in accordance with Policies D4, T1, T2, T4 and T5 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | Prior to occupation of the development a noise assessment report shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of external noise sources including transport/ industrial/ commercial/ cultural uses and their noise levels occurring at the site during most of the year, ie. measured during school and work weekdays. Details shall include the sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications (laboratory tested including frames, seals, and any integral ventilators, approved in accordance with BS EN ISO 10140-2:2010) and of acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and details of self-noise). Details of internal noise levels according to BS8233:2014 shall be provided, together with best practicable mitigation measures, as necessary, to achieve the criteria for external amenity spaces.
The approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with Policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), Policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Policy D14 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| Prior to occupation of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of enhanced sound insulation values of at least 5dB above the ADE Building Regulations values, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings/areas, namely, bedrooms adjoining/ above/ below kitchen/ dining/ living/ bathroom/ WC of separate flats and of at least 10dB enhancement for bedroom adjoining the communal stairwell. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with Policies D6, D13 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
| Control measures shall ensure that the following standards are implemented
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays (no work on public holidays),
- neighbour liaison, notifications to interested parties and considerate complaints procedure,
- public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the work for the duration of the works in case of emergencies, enquiries or complaints.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with Policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with Preliminary Ecological Appraisal R2693_PEA_a (John Wenman Ecological Consultancy) and Biodiversity Net Gain Assessment Report R2693_BNG_a (John Wenman Ecological Consultancy) to achieve 62.59% biodiversity net gain. The landowner is legally responsible for creating and enhancing the habitats identified in Preliminary Ecological Appraisal R2693_PEA_a (John Wenman Ecological Consultancy) and Biodiversity Net Gain Assessment Report R2693_BNG_a (John Wenman Ecological Consultancy), and managing these habitats for at least 30 years from when you complete creating or enhancing the habitat to satisfy this condition.

The Local Planning Authority has several powers to efficiently monitor biodiversity net gain, including Planning Contravention Notices (PCN), which are a requisition for information from landowners or operators. Non-compliance with a Planning Contravention Notice or providing misinformation can result in prosecution and fines.
If the habitat enhancement does not go as planned and the 62.59% biodiversity net gain cannot be achieved, you must notify the planning authority immediately.

Reason: To ensure that the biodiversity gain objective is met, in accordance with Schedule 7A of the Town and Country Planning Act (1990), Policy G6 of the London Plan (2021) and Planning practice guidance on biodiversity net gain Biodiversity net gain - GOV.UK (www.gov.uk)
description: Construction a two storey building, with part habitable loft space to accommodate 9 self-contained residential units and provision of associated cycle storage and refuse storage facilities. (Following demolition of existing building)
